content:
• Wednesday, March 27, 2013
  • MMTOY

    Mitsubishi Motors (OTC:MMTOY -3.9%) slips in local trade after earlier reporting two malfunction...

    Mitsubishi Motors (OTC:MMTOY -3.9%) slips in local trade after earlier reporting two malfunction incidents with batteries made in a joint venture with GS Yuasa (OTCPK:GYUAF) - whose shares currently remain untraded.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 PM
  • ATEA

    Astea International (OTC:ATEA) moves high in the post session despite reporting a decline in Q4...

    Astea International (OTC:ATEA) moves high in the post session despite reporting a decline in Q4 sales to $6.5M, compared to $6.9M for the same period in 2011. The company blames the shortfall on lower service and maintenance revenues. Net income rose however, to $582K or $.16 per share, compared to $480K or $.13 per share for the same period in 2011. The company also commented that it expects overall progress and growth for 2013, with several new products releases planned. Shares +15% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 PM
  • ARRY

    Array Biopharma (NASDAQ:ARRY) says it's entered into a sales agreement for an at-the-market...

    Array Biopharma (NASDAQ:ARRY) says it's entered into a sales agreement for an at-the-market share offering with Cantor Fitzgerald. Subject to the terms and conditions, ARRY] may from time to time issue and sell through Cantor up to $75M in stock. Shares -5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • XONE

    ExOne (NASDAQ:XONE): Q4 net income of $902K. Revenue of $12.7M beats by $0.4M. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)

    ExOne (NASDAQ:XONE): Q4 net income of $902K. Revenue of $12.7M beats by $0.4M. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • GBX

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GBX +3%. GNW +3%. LCC +3%. MATX +1.4%. SU +1.1%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GBX +3%. GNW +3%. LCC +3%. MATX +1.4%. SU +1.1%.
    After-hours top losers: ARRY -12%. RHT -9%. FIVE -7%. ESI-OLD -6%. PVH -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • PVH

    More on PVH (NYSE:PVH): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue, driven by higher profit across...

    More on PVH (NYSE:PVH): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue, driven by higher profit across virtually all its business lines. The stock is down in the post-session however, as the company issues mixed guidance for the coming year and current quarter. For 2013, it now projects revenue to be about $8.2B and EPS at $7 per share. The Street is at $7.66B in revenue and earnings of $7.42 per share. For Q1, the company is looking for an EPS of $1.33 versus analysts estimates for $1.52, on sales of $1.90B versus the $1.85B Street estimate. Shares -4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • SCS

    More on Steelcase (NYSE:SCS): Q4 beats slightly on the revenue side, but net earnings swung to a...

    More on Steelcase (NYSE:SCS): Q4 beats slightly on the revenue side, but net earnings swung to a fiscal fourth-quarter loss as impairment charges and restructuring costs weighed on results. The company also guides lower for its Q1, now anticipating an EPS of $0.09 to $0.13 on revenue of $ 680M to $705M. Analysts were projecting $0.18 on $711M in revenue. Shares -3.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • AAL

    A U.S. bankruptcy judge signs off on US Airways' (LCC) merger with American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK)....

    A U.S. bankruptcy judge signs off on US Airways' (LCC) merger with American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK). Approval was widely expected, but US Airways is still up 2.4% AH. AMR creditors holding $1.2B in claims are already backing the deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • PVH

    PVH (NYSE:PVH): Q4 EPS of $1.60 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $1.64B beats by $0.04B. Shares -5.2%...

    PVH (NYSE:PVH): Q4 EPS of $1.60 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $1.64B beats by $0.04B. Shares -5.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • CYCC

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CYCC): Q4 EPS of -$0.59. Shares +5.4% AH. (PR)

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CYCC): Q4 EPS of -$0.59. Shares +5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) says it's initiated Phase 3 studies of blisibimod, for the...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) says it's initiated Phase 3 studies of blisibimod, for the treatment of systemic lupus erythematosus. Lupus is a chronic autoimmune disease, which often leads to severe skin rash, fatigue, joint pain and major organ complications. Shares -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • CTXS

    Much like they did last week following Oracle's FQ3 miss, some enterprise IT names are selling...

    Much like they did last week following Oracle's FQ3 miss, some enterprise IT names are selling off AH following Red Hat's FQ4 revenue miss, which was accompanied by slowing deferred revenue growth. CTXS -2%. VMW -1.9%. FFIV -1.1%. RVBD -2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • ATEA

    Astea International (OTC:ATEA): Q4 EPS of $0.16. Revenue of $6.5M. Shares +15.2% AH. (PR)

    Astea International (OTC:ATEA): Q4 EPS of $0.16. Revenue of $6.5M. Shares +15.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) says it will curtail production at its Willow Creek mine in British...

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) says it will curtail production at its Willow Creek mine in British Columbia, resulting in 250 job losses out of 350 workers employed there. Willow Creek is the fifth mine WLT has announced plans to curtail or idle as part of its initiatives to address underperforming assets. Shares -1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • TEVA

    Shares of Teva (TEVA -1.2%) close lower today on the back of Biogen's (BIIB +3%) earlier...

    Shares of Teva (TEVA -1.2%) close lower today on the back of Biogen's (BIIB +3%) earlier announcement of FDA approval for its MS capsule Tecfidera. Earlier in the week, TEVA had announced its own successful results from Phase III testing for its Multiple Sclerosis drug Laquinimod.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): Q4 EPS of $0.36 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $348M (+17% Y/Y) misses by $1.6M....

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): Q4 EPS of $0.36 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $348M (+17% Y/Y) misses by $1.6M. Shares -6.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • ASH

    Jefferies cuts its 2013 and 2014 earnings outlook on Ashland (ASH -3%), citing weaker end-market...

    Jefferies cuts its 2013 and 2014 earnings outlook on Ashland (ASH -3%), citing weaker end-market demand prospects that could affect growth and the timing of any divestitures. Deutsche Bank says ASH's expected FQ2 earnings shortfall has eroded investor goodwill, proving the business "less resilient than we thought." Both firms maintained Buy ratings but cut price targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +3.5%) wins FDA approval for its Tecfidera capsules, a treatment for adults...

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +3.5%) wins FDA approval for its Tecfidera capsules, a treatment for adults with relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU -0.9%) says it won't require customers to prove that yoga pants purchased from...

    Lululemon (LULU -0.9%) says it won't require customers to prove that yoga pants purchased from the retailer are too sheer before issuing a refund. Yesterday, a solitary report cropped up indicating a customer demonstration was required. Shares of LULU are down about ~12% since the issue with the black luon pants was first revealed - roughly the same percentage the product makes up of total sales for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • TRS

    TriMas (TRS +0.8%) acquires Wulfrun Specialised Fasteners for around $9.6M, subject to net...

    TriMas (TRS +0.8%) acquires Wulfrun Specialised Fasteners for around $9.6M, subject to net working capital adjustments. Wulfrun is a manufacturer and distributer of specialty bolting and CNC machined components for use in oil and gas, pipeline and power generation applications. which generated approximately $10M in revenue in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +2.4%) enjoys an afternoon pop after BTIG raises its price target on the...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +2.4%) enjoys an afternoon pop after BTIG raises its price target on the Buy-rated stock to $40 from $26. BTIG includes the contemplated fifth and sixth Sabine Pass liquefaction trains into its model assumptions for LNG after the company fulfilled most of the goals the firm had set for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (ZGNX -0.8%) and Battelle, the world's largest independent research and development...

    Zogenix (ZGNX -0.8%) and Battelle, the world's largest independent research and development organization, say they've extended a co-marketing partnership for the DosePro needle-free drug delivery system through March, 2014. The partnership is focused on advancing the out-licensing opportunities for the system, with a focus on co-marketing the technology to potential biopharmaceutical and government clients.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • NJDCY

    Japanese manufacturer Nidec (NJ +2.3%) announces plans to establish Nidec Automotive Motor...

    Japanese manufacturer Nidec (NJ +2.3%) announces plans to establish Nidec Automotive Motor Americas Corporation as the strategic base for its automotive motor business in markets in the Americas. The company, which bought Illinois-based motor manufacturer Kinetek last year, has set a capital and capital reserve of $41.3M for the venture.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • NBIX

    Neurocrine Biosciences (NBIX +22%) gains after announcing earlier that its initiated Phase IIb...

    Neurocrine Biosciences (NBIX +22%) gains after announcing earlier that its initiated Phase IIb clinical trials to evaluate Elagolix for the treatment of uterine fibroids. Elagolix is an oral gonadotropin-releasing hormone antagonist currently in collaborative development by its partner AbbVie (ABBV -0.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • AXL

    American Axle (AXL +4.3%) rallies after dipping slightly in Tuesday's post-trading session, when...

    American Axle (AXL +4.3%) rallies after dipping slightly in Tuesday's post-trading session, when it disclosed its FY13 outlook. The company anticipates FY13 sales to be $3.25B, slightly below the consensus estimate of $3.27B, adding that it expects the labor strike at GM's Rayong factory in Thailand to have an estimated adverse impact on Q1 sales of approximately $15M. However, it also said its rate of sales has increased to about 15M vehicle units in FY13 from 14.4M vehicle units in FY12, which is fueling the upside move today.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • PANW

    Next-gen firewalls (NGFWs) address a security hardware market Gartner thinks will be worth $9B...

    Next-gen firewalls (NGFWs) address a security hardware market Gartner thinks will be worth $9B in 2016, writes Needham, which is starting NGFW leader Palo Alto Networks (PANW +3.7%) with a Buy and $70 PT. Needham sees NGFWs, which support deeper content analysis than traditional firewalls, addressing several major security trends. Among them: the need to control "risky" Web services such as chat, the rise of APT attacks, the mobile and BYOD trends, and the network complexity and security risks spawned by virtualization and software-defined networking.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • SHPG

    Viropharma (VPHM +4.3%) gets a lift today from a valuation upgrade to Overweight at JPMorgan...

    Viropharma (VPHM +4.3%) gets a lift today from a valuation upgrade to Overweight at JPMorgan with a price target of $32 a share. Analyst Brian Abrahams thinks the competitive threats to VPHM's Angioedema treatment Cinryze have been overstated relative to its peers, noting that although some early-stage treatments by its competitors are "worth keeping an eye on," they have characteristics which make them a less-attractive alternative.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • SNY

    The insulin war heats up, as Sanofi (SNY -0.9%) loses a key pitchman to archrival Novo Nordisk...

    The insulin war heats up, as Sanofi (SNY -0.9%) loses a key pitchman to archrival Novo Nordisk (NOVOB.PK). Former professional cyclist Phil Southerland, a diabetic whose team was funded by SNY for the past six years, has jumped ship along with his crew, now calling themselves Team Novo Nordisk. The stakes in this battle are big, as the global diabetes drug market right now runs at around $35B and continues to climb. At present, SNY dominates the market with Lantus, but its patent expires in 2015, and NOVOB - despite recent setbacks - continues to draft close behind.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHCI

    Midday top 10 gainers: CHCI +45%. RVLT +35%. UEPS +24%. LIVE +20%. UTSI +20%. ECYT +11%. MFRM...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CHCI +45%. RVLT +35%. UEPS +24%. LIVE +20%. UTSI +20%. ECYT +11%. MFRM +10%. STSI +10%. PGTI +10%. GSL +10%.
    Midday top 10 losers: ASTM -38%. EVBS -23%. ISNS -19%. ATOS -14%. CLF -15%. BAA -13%. GV -12%. LOGM -11%. MBLX -11%. LEDS -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -3.8%) slips lower after S&P Capital IQ cuts its rating on the retailer to...

    Best Buy (BBY -3.8%) slips lower after S&P Capital IQ cuts its rating on the retailer to Sell from Hold on a valuation call.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • VASC

    Investors shrug off what appears to be old news about an FDA recall of Vascular Solutions (VASC...

    Investors shrug off what appears to be old news about an FDA recall of Vascular Solutions (VASC +5.3%) Guardian II valve, pushing the stock higher after Piper Jaffray initiated the shares with an Overweight rating and an $18 price target. The company had issued its own recall of the valve earlier this month, citing a slightly increased risk of air leakage that may lead to an air embolism, which could result in serious injury or death.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • BAA

    Banro (BAA -12.1%) shares sink on earlier news the gold explorer plans an offering of common and...

    Banro (BAA -12.1%) shares sink on earlier news the gold explorer plans an offering of common and preferred shares to raise up to $100M and posts a Q4 profit of $0.03/share; 19,840 oz. of gold were sold at an average price of $1,711/oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • AAPL

    Estimate cuts from Pac Crest's Andy Hargreaves are helping Apple (AAPL -2%) underperform. Citing...

    Estimate cuts from Pac Crest's Andy Hargreaves are helping Apple (AAPL -2%) underperform. Citing weak demand for the 9.7" iPad - he thinks this is likely "a sustained trend" as demand shifts to smaller/cheaper tablets - and a demand pause ahead of a refresh, Hargreaves is cutting his FQ3 (June quarter) iPad forecast to 15M units from 18.5M. He also thinks "the high end of the smartphone market is quickly becoming saturated," and has lowered FQ2 and FQ4 revenue/EPS estimates further below consensus. Hargreaves cut Apple to Sector Perform on Jan. 16, when shares were at $503.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 43 Comments
  • NAVB

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +0.8%) bucks a weak tape after saying it's commenced enrollment...

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +0.8%) bucks a weak tape after saying it's commenced enrollment in Phase 2b positron emission tomography imaging studies of NAV4694, a scan for detecting cerebral-amyloid plaque in subjects diagnosed with Mild Cognitive Impairment. The study is designed to investigate whether scan findings have the ability to distinguish between subjects with MCI who progress to Alzheimer's disease from those who do not.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical Partners (CPRX -1.9%) slips into the red after opening +8% on the back...

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical Partners (CPRX -1.9%) slips into the red after opening +8% on the back of its earlier announcement that the independent Data Monitoring Committee overseeing CPRX's Phase III clinical trials of Firdapse, a potential treatment for Lambert-Easton Myasthenic Syndrome, gave the go-ahead to continue the trial as planned based on a review of safety and clinical data.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • GV

    Goldfield (GV -15%) takes a hit today despite reporting solid FY12 results late yesterday. Net...

    Goldfield (GV -15%) takes a hit today despite reporting solid FY12 results late yesterday. Net income increased in 2012 to $0.47 per share from $0.03 per share in FY11, while revenue came in at $81.6M in FY12, up from $32.8M the prior year. On the surface, these numbers may be encouraging, but Seeking Alpha contributor Sarah Tyler thinks thinks the company's declining backlog and over-reaching margins point to more difficult times ahead for the utility transmission and distribution contractor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • MMTOY

    Just when you think the smoke has cleared: Mitsubishi Motors (OTC:MMTOY) reports two recent...

    Just when you think the smoke has cleared: Mitsubishi Motors (OTC:MMTOY) reports two recent accidents involving lithium-ion batteries manufactured by its joint venture with GS Yuasa (OTCPK:GYUAF), the maker of batteries used in Boeing's (BA -1.1%) grounded 787 Dreamliner. The Japanese auto maker said a lithium-ion battery pack used in its i-MiEV model electric car caught fire while charging during a test inspection at a company plant in Okayama last week, while in another incident, a battery installed in one of its Outlander PHEV hybrids overheated, melting the cell and part of the battery pack.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • CLF

    More commentary on Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -13.3%) comes from Cowen's Anthony Rizzuto...

    More commentary on Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -13.3%) comes from Cowen's Anthony Rizzuto after meeting with CEO Joe Carrabba yesterday. Cowen thinks CLF is taking a "somewhat aggressive stance" on supply in the industry; CLF says moves by global iron ore producers away from greenfield investment could lead to a supply crunch over the medium term. (earlier:I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 5 Comments
  • DS

    Buy the (rapidly disappearing) dip in Newcastle Investment (NCT +3.2%) says UBS, waving off last...

    Buy the (rapidly disappearing) dip in Newcastle Investment (NCT +3.2%) says UBS, waving off last week's weakness as needless concern about higher prepayments and the impact on the MSR portfolio from the imminent spinoff of New Residential. UBS gives the still-combined operation a price target of $14.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • Z

    Look for Trulia (TRLA +1.8%) to close its valuation gap with Zillow (Z -0.3%), writes Deutsche's...

    Look for Trulia (TRLA +1.8%) to close its valuation gap with Zillow (Z -0.3%), writes Deutsche's Lloyd Walmsley, who's upgrading the former to Buy. Whereas Zillow has risen 23% since Feb. 15 (going into today), Trulia has fallen 14%, and its 2014E EV/EBITDA multiple is now 21% lower. Walmsley argues Trulia's follow-on offering strengthens its M&A flexibility, and sees the company delivering "a more articulated strategy to deepen agent relationships over time."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • ENZN

    Enzon Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ENZN -2.8%) hits a new 52-week low after disclosing in a regulatory...

    Enzon Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ENZN -2.8%) hits a new 52-week low after disclosing in a regulatory filing late yesterday that it's reducing its workforce from 19 employees to 12. It expects to incur about $1.3M in charges related to the reduction in force, due to cash expenditures for one-time employee termination benefits and associated costs. The company expects to record the charges and complete the reduction by the end of Q1.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney's (JCP -1.1%) new "mark-up to mark-down" tactic may be straight from Retail 101 but...

    J.C. Penney's (JCP -1.1%) new "mark-up to mark-down" tactic may be straight from Retail 101 but it's a tough row to hoe for a company suffering +20% drops in sales, according to analysts. Is JCP making the transition smoothly? Eyes in the street note that items in stores are "awkwardly" displaying stickers over the older prices in an effort to cover them up.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 15 Comments
  • CLF

    This morning's crippling downgrades of Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -12.9%) send shares,...

    This morning's crippling downgrades of Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -12.9%) send shares, already -51% YTD, plunging to four-year lows. Morgan Stanley believes CLF's U.S. iron ore business, ~60% of 2012 EBITDA, will be cut in half in coming years as new Great Lakes supply cuts into volumes and pricing. Credit Suisse offers similar concerns. Morgan's bear case for CLF shares: $1. CS bear case: zero.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • STM

    European tech and telecom stocks are underperforming as continental equities sell off on Italian...

    European tech and telecom stocks are underperforming as continental equities sell off on Italian concerns. STM -3.9%. ALU -2.3%. NXPI -1.4%. FTE -4.3%. TEF -2.1%. TI -4.3%. VOD -1.7%. One exception is Nokia (NOK +0.3%), which is benefiting from an upgrade to Buy from Swedbank.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 6 Comments
  • NTR

    The battle for board seats at Agrium (AGU -3.2%) grew more complex overnight, as proxy advisory...

    The battle for board seats at Agrium (AGU -3.2%) grew more complex overnight, as proxy advisory firm ISS endorsed two dissident nominees while Glass Lewis backed AGU’s entire slate. "A board still loudly repudiating the very changes it has begun to implement... is a board with a burgeoning credibility problem," ISS writes; "ISS simply got this one wrong,"AGU responds.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW +1.2%) rises on a down day after ISI upgrades shares to Strong Buy from Buy. Shares...

    VMware (VMW +1.2%) rises on a down day after ISI upgrades shares to Strong Buy from Buy. Shares have gradually given back most of the big gains they saw earlier this month due to the strong growth outlook provided on the company's investor day.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • AOL

    Barclays upgrades AOL (AOL +8.4%) to Overweight, and sends shares to $39 in the process. After...

    Barclays upgrades AOL (AOL +8.4%) to Overweight, and sends shares to $39 in the process. After hitting a high of $43.93 in mid-February in the wake of strong Q4 numbers, AOL had gradually sold off, reaching a low of $33.58 on March 18.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • TPX

    Mattress stocks in focus: Tempur Pedic (TPX +3.6%) trades higher after Mattress Firm (MFRM...

    Mattress stocks in focus: Tempur Pedic (TPX +3.6%) trades higher after Mattress Firm (MFRM +6.7%) misses estimates with its Q4 earnings report and issues relatively in-line guidance. Though Raymond James is out with a defense on Mattress Firm, the momentum rally in the sector looks a bit overdone to some traders.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • RAX

    Rackspace (RAX -3.4%) falls towards $50 after CLSA starts coverage with an Underperform and $52...

    Rackspace (RAX -3.4%) falls towards $50 after CLSA starts coverage with an Underperform and $52 PT. Pac Crest downgraded Rackspace to Sector Perform last week. Shares -32% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • GPT

    Gramercy Capital (GKK) CEO Gordon Dugan added 2.5% to his stake in the company, purchasing 50K...

    Gramercy Capital (GKK) CEO Gordon Dugan added 2.5% to his stake in the company, purchasing 50K shares at $4.33 each last week following earnings and the update on the company's business plan. The stock takes out another 52-week high today, +4.6% to $4.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 11 Comments
  • RCPI

    Star Scientific (STSI) jumps 10.1% after apparently convincing investors with its response...

    Star Scientific (STSI) jumps 10.1% after apparently convincing investors with its response yesterday to a class action lawsuit that questions the validity of the company's research into its dietary supplements and cosmetic products. "It is difficult to conceive of a more inappropriate class action plaintiff representative," Star said. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • BIOF

    BioFuel Energy (BIOF -11.2%) slides after saying Tuesday night it has engaged Piper Jaffray to...

    BioFuel Energy (BIOF -11.2%) slides after saying Tuesday night it has engaged Piper Jaffray to help it pursue strategic alternatives for asset sales in connection with a default by the company's operating subsidiaries. Through December, unpaid principal and interest totaled $8.2M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • FGP

    Ferrellgas Partners (FGP -3.3%) sinks at the open, apparently the result of a Seeking Alpha blog...

    Ferrellgas Partners (FGP -3.3%) sinks at the open, apparently the result of a Seeking Alpha blog post that calls the stock "a balloon ready to pop... not only are the shares extremely overpriced, but that the 'income' investors are receiving is sustained only by an ever increasing mountain of debt and perpetual issuance of new shares."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 9 Comments
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial (HIG -1.6%) will record a charge of $200M in Q1 for its just-completed tender...

    Hartford Financial (HIG -1.6%) will record a charge of $200M in Q1 for its just-completed tender for $800M in senior notes. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • VCEL

    Aastrom Biosciences (ASTM) craters 32% out the gate after saying it plans to cut its staff and...

    Aastrom Biosciences (ASTM) craters 32% out the gate after saying it plans to cut its staff and operating costs by 50%, and end Phase III trials of its ixmyelocel-T drug for patients with critical limb ischemia - when there is an sudden lack of blood flow to a limb - as it was unable to bring in a partner. Instead, Aastrom will focus on Phase 2b trials of ixCELL for treating dilated cardiomyopathy (heart muscle disease). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • CHCI

    Premarket gainers: CHCI +51%. UTSI +23%. STSI +14%. VELT +12%. CHTP +11%.   Losers: ASTM...

    Premarket gainers: CHCI +51%. UTSI +23%. STSI +14%. VELT +12%. CHTP +11%.
    Losers: ASTM -37%. CLF -14%. GV -7%. LNDC -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • WMT

    Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) slips lower in premarket trading, down 0.8%, after the company says it...

    Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) slips lower in premarket trading, down 0.8%, after the company says it expects losses of around $157M (and counting) related to the Mexico bribery scandal. Though it's a big jump from the $99M in costs from just three months ago, analysts note the amount is about where they expected it to be.
